<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 10"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Command Attention](/Feats.aspx?ID=6301) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
<trait label="Auditory" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=541" />
<trait label="Aura" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=542" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Emotion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=590" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=647" />
<trait label="Visual" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=727" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 194 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Celebrity](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=245)

**Prerequisites**
[Celebrity Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6298)

</column>

---

You command the attention of all around you with style, ensuring their gaze falls only upon you until the end of your next turn. Whenever a creature in a 30-foot emanation around you attempts a saving throw against a different visual effect, it gets a result one degree of success better than it rolled. This is a [fortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=612) effect. When an enemy within the aura attempts to use a visual effect that involves focusing its attention on a particular creature (such as a medusa’s Focus Gaze), it must succeed at a Will save against your [class DC](/Rules.aspx?ID=23) or [spell DC](/Rules.aspx?ID=2293), whichever is higher, in order to target any creature except you. Allies in the aura can attempt to [Hide](/Actions.aspx?ID=2404) even if they don’t have cover, as you are continually providing a distraction.
